stem: The nurse is triaging victims at the scene of a mass casualty event. Select the 3 clients who should be assigned a 'RED' (Emergent) tag.

options.text: A client with an open pneumothorax and respiratory distress.
A client with 2nd-degree burns on 10% of the body who is walking.
A client with no pulse and fixed dilated pupils.
A client with an arterial bleed that is spurting from the leg.
A client with tension pneumothorax and tracheal deviation.
A client with a closed fracture of the radius who is crying.

rationale.correct: Red tags are for life-threatening but treatable injuries. Arterial bleeds (a), open pneumothorax (b), and tension pneumothorax (d) all require immediate intervention to save life.
rationale.incorrect: Walking wounded (c) are Green. Black tags (e) are for those who are deceased or have unsurvivable injuries. Minor fractures (f) are Green or Yellow.

answerBreakdown.label: A
answerBreakdown.content: "A client with an open pneumothorax and respiratory distress." represents a critical metric that must be monitored to evaluate the effectiveness of the current medical plan.

answerBreakdown.label: B
answerBreakdown.content: While plausible in other contexts, "A client with 2nd-degree burns on 10% of the body who is walking." is not the highest priority or most relevant factor in this acute scenario.

answerBreakdown.label: C
answerBreakdown.content: Choosing "A client with no pulse and fixed dilated pupils." represents a misinterpretation of the gathered cues or a failure to prioritize physiological needs.

answerBreakdown.label: D
answerBreakdown.content: "A client with an arterial bleed that is spurting from the leg." represents a critical metric that must be monitored to evaluate the effectiveness of the current medical plan.

answerBreakdown.label: E
answerBreakdown.content: Selecting "A client with tension pneumothorax and tracheal deviation." is evidence-based as it directly correlates with the primary clinical cues and pathophysiology.

answerBreakdown.label: F
answerBreakdown.content: Choosing "A client with a closed fracture of the radius who is crying." represents a misinterpretation of the gathered cues or a failure to prioritize physiological needs.

clinicalPearls: RPM: Respirations (>30), Perfusion (Cap refill > 2s), Mental Status (Can't follow commands) = RED.

questionTrap.howToOvercome: Don't 'waste' a red tag on someone who is already dead or has no pulse (Black), as resources must go to those who can be saved.

reviewUnits.heading: Disaster Nursing
reviewUnits.body: Triage in a disaster focuses on doing the greatest good for the greatest number.
